title: Infinite Scroll List
description:
Design an infinite scroll list that progressively loads more items from a paginated API as the user scrolls. Focus on smooth scrolling, clear loading/error states, and keeping DOM size under control.

Functional requirements:
- Render an initial page of items from a paginated API
- As the user approaches the bottom, load and append the next page
- Show loading feedback (e.g. skeletons or spinner) while fetching
- Handle errors with an inline retry option
- Show an explicit "end of list" state when there is no more data
- Support pluggable item rendering (rows, cards, etc.)

Non-functional:
- Scrolling should feel smooth on mid-range devices (no visible jank)
- UI states (loading, error, empty, end-of-list) must be clearly represented
- DOM size should remain reasonable even after long sessions
- Accessible to keyboard and screen readers

Data constraints:
- API exposes either page/limit or cursor-based pagination
- Typical list can contain tens of thousands of items overall
- Users may scroll through thousands of items in one session
- Network latency and throughput may vary (mobile connections included)
